dmca.title: Trademark Infringement
dmca.body:
[private]

Re: Trademark Infringement

Dear Sir:

Bank of America Corporation is the owner of multiple trademark registrations in the United States for BANK OF AMERICA (Registration Nos. 1466524, 0932728, 0873828, and 0853860) and BANK OF AMERICA & Stripes Design (Registration Nos. 2494690, 2488156, 2650927 and 2488154). Our BANK OF AMERICA mark has been in use since 1928. The right to use these trademarks belongs exclusively to Bank of America Corporation.

We have learned that your company has been using our BANK OF AMERICA & Stripes Design trademark (our corporate logo) on your website at www.support-intelligence.com. Although we certainly appreciate that you cannot avoid using our name when discussing Bank of America, the use of our corporate logo is not necessary and creates the possibility that some readers might believe that your web site or its content is sponsored by or affiliated with Bank of America. We request that you remove our logo from your web site. 

Please provide a written response to this letter by May 21, 2007.

We look forward to hearing from you and hope this matter can be resolved quickly. 

Sincerely,

xxx

Assistant General Council

--

Additional Information NOT in the C&D letter

BofA is referring to our blog at: www.support-intelligence.com/blog where we write about many corporate networks with botnet infections on them. The posting was from April 19th 2007.
